intro: Gymnopteris aurita, commonly known as the golden fern, is a species of fern characterized by its distinctive fronds. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is native to regions of Southeast Asia. The plant features bipinnate fronds with a golden hue on the underside, which gives it its common name. Gymnopteris aurita typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its reproductive structures, including sori, are located on the underside of the fronds, typical of many fern species.
